author: Hayley Walker
comment: love this app really easy to use and makes you more conscious of how many u are smoking a day. only a few things would make this an even better app and they are 1) being able to rate what kind of day i was having as a whole and being able to add a note for the whole day not just for each cigarette. ie having a stressful day at work. 2) the graph showing time between cigarettes and amount had not that clear to understand. other than these things i think it is a great app. would definitely recommend

Update: Cannot praise developer highly enough. Immediately responded to a query and a suggestion. Excellent!  The best assistant to giving up smoking that I have found. Easy to use but comprehensive history, targeting and incentives make it a no brainer to rate 5 Stars.  One feature request - the option to remember the last used time scale when using Chart History facility. Currently always defaults to 90 days and I ALWAYS change to 30. No major chore but it would be great if it remembered.  Paid for this app within hours of installing. Excellent.  Significant reduction in my smoking by the way. Thanks.  Amendment: Add to the words above that the developer is incredibly responsive. Superb.

reply.author: Cory Charlton
reply.content: I would be happy to add this feature. Please contact me at support@ccswe.com if you have additional questions or feedback. Update: I just released a beta version that remembers chart settings. Please contact if you would like early access to it.

author: Crystal Rose
comment: I already cut my smoking in half on day one. I've been looking for a tracker for a long time. It makes me conscious of when, why and triggers by recording details before I light up. I think I will quit successfully this time. It's also helpful discerning my emotions throughout the day. The developer may want to make a sepearate app for once you quit to simply record how you're feeling at a given moment, it's helpful to access your triggers and calms me down a bit just to record it and see patterns. Thank you

reply.author: Cory Charlton
reply.content: Best of luck with quitting. Don't hesitate to contact us at support@ccswe.com if you have any questions or feedback.

author: gary ponsford
comment: This app would be really good if, after each smoke per day, it recalculated the time to the next one by using the target number, less the number smoked, across the number of hours left on that particular day, rather than retaining the originally calculated time at the start of the day. Is that something that could be considered?

reply.author: Cory Charlton
reply.content: I'm always happy to discuss feature requests. Shoot me an email at support@ccswe.com with your ideas

author: Jim Strupp
comment: Does what it says. Very easy to use. I wish that it had hourly charting for the day so that I could see visually the times of day that are Peak and Valley times. Using the widget makes it very easy to become a habit tracking each smoke.

reply.author: Cory Charlton
reply.content: I just added this chart to version 4.1.5 beta. Would love to hear your feedback. Email me at support@ccswe.com if you need help getting access to the beta.

author: NICK TAYLOR
comment: Great app, I really like how on my android phone it is always on notifications and the text is red if my goal between smokes is not met yet.

author: Leisha Wharfield
comment: This app has already helped me smoke less, and it's helping me quit!

author: Diantha Gourdin
comment: Simple, easy to use. Really helping me cut back!

author: Mac Dermott
comment: 3 weeks clean almost

author: Sheila Trombley
comment: It really helps as I am cutting down to quit💜

author: Asef B
comment: Simple.. And very helpful 😁

author: Aesus Ho
comment: Excellent

author: Draeas Talonsbane
comment: This is a simple, functional and handy program- it does exactly what I wanted and hasn't got cheesy motivational messages, just a simple "Good on you for not smoking" message when you press the button to soon.  One suggestion; an optional sound- any sound/song/tone- the user has which plays when the time is up (you can smoke). You hear the sound, light your cig and press the button/log the smoke then there is a user delay ['x' minutes]- a rough estimate of time it takes you individually to actually smoke the cig- and then the timer starts again automatically. The reason is I like a lot of people tend to watch YouTube or go on Facebook etc. on my phone when I go outside to smoke and end up watching the video/reading after the cig then just go back to whatever I was doing and totally forget to push the button to start the timer again. Hope you find my suggestion helpful, it is the only problem I have with an otherwise excellent and simple piece of software. Well done

author: Mind Your Dirt
comment: The simplicity of this app makes using it a breeze. I'm having fun tracking my progress as I ween myself off of the coffin nails. I'm also taking Chantix while using this.  The support team is great here as well. They helped me transfer my data over to a new phone and responded right away. Very helpful!  My only recommendation is a few tweaks with the graphs. Being able to set a default view would be helpful. i.e. locking it in for the last 7 days for example. Also the time/cig count graph is a bit non-intuiative and confusing. I feel like that can be redesigned to be cleaner and make more sense. Maybe break it up into two separate graphs, one above the other? Having the green (# of smokes) melt behind the blue (time between smokes) just doesn't sit well with me. Just a thought.  Bottom line is, this has been a very helpful tool! If you get an actual designer involved for the layout and such, you'd have solid gold here. Cheers!

author: Ta Ge
comment: It's not super fancy. It is helping me to track my smoking habits which I'm really liking. It's not immediate, but it had been helping me to watch my cigarette\nicotine intake.

author: Joanna Lewis
comment: The app is good but the excel exports spit out meaningless numbers. For example, on one entry I have a feeling score of 80 and others at -1, when the input scale is between 1-10.  If you fix this or explain it to me I'll give it 5 stars.

reply.author: Cory Charlton
reply.content: -1 indicates not set. If you email me at support@ccswe.com I can provide a mapping of the feelings.

author: Diane Jones
comment: I had tried to cut down on my smoking before and found it very difficult to cut back by maybe three to five a day. Using this app from the start I cut my smoking in half just by being conscious of the amount of time that had elapsed since my last cigarette. It has really helped me psychologically. And because the smoking interval is self-imposed I don't feel guilty if I don't make it to, say, 50 minutes. At least I know that each time I smoke it's a conscious decision and not a mindless act. I recommend this app to anyone trying to cut down or quit smoking. P.S. I started Chantix today and will be reducing my number of cigarettes goal throughout the next couple of weeks.

author: Andro Chilaia
comment: App idea is good but... 1. Don't counts cigarettes avg. time correctly, 2. Design is not well and some options too

reply.author: Cory Charlton
reply.content: Sorry to hear you are not pleased with Smoking Log. Feel free to contact me at support@ccswe.com to discuss any problems you are experiencing.

author: Curtis Harbin
comment: this is a very simple, easy to use, and a very useful app to keep track of the cigs you smoke or if vaping, of the ones you don't smoke. history and comments for each time you light one up or keep track of your history.

author: Sara Mahoney
comment: Simple and easy to use. I can quickly log my cigarettes. It is good to be able to look back and see how I am doing cutting back.

reply.author: Cory Charlton
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback! Don't hesitate to contact us at support@ccswe.com if you have any questions or suggestions.

author: Mina Nady
comment: It helps you to track how many cigarettes and time intervals between them. So you can set your plan to decrease numbers or Quit
As good as it gets for tracking cigarette usage. I like that you can make corrections, and that it tells you average time between smokes.

author: Sharon Marie Rentz
comment: Pretty good app; husband quit with it and I just started using it :)

author: Jonesy Cast
comment: Pretty dope. Does what it says it does. Can't ask for more.

author: Kathy Bond
comment: So far, So good

author: John Yeum
comment: Simple the best app for smoking log

author: Soozie Q
comment: Simple to use

author: rudienmaylene du plooy
comment: Smoking alot less in my 1st 7 days

reply.author: Cory Charlton
reply.content: Glad to hear that Smoking Log is helping you cut down. Don't hesitate to contact us at support@ccswe.com if you have any questions or feedback.

comment: *edit* Developer was quick to reply and fix the issue - back to 5 stars now! (Notification no longer works in Android 8 after the last update. Will go back to 5 stars once fixed. - fixed)

reply.author: Cory Charlton
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback. Please contact us at support@ccswe.com so we can gather more information on the problem.

comment: Works well for what I was looking for.  Gives you wait times if you are trying to slow down or quit smoking.  Makes you conscience of how much you smoke and when.

author: Cassandra Cook
comment: I like it just kinda wish I could put in a quit date and slow to a stop at the date

author: Jennifer Mattern
comment: Simple and easy to use. I don't use a lot of the log features (mood, craving, etc. Works for me.

author: Guy Shalom
comment: Great app.. So far so good, goals achieved 😁

author: Mesrop Davoyan
comment: It seems that I'm quitting smoking

author: filippo m
comment: great app , easy and intuitive, light (a few MB only) and effective

author: Deana Wicks
comment: Does just what it says it out will. Works perfect :)

author: cam Clark
comment: Great app but I have a suggestion. It would be great to tell the app I'm going to bed, and I woke up. And that would automatically adjust the average time between cigarettes. If I have even one after midnight, then wake up at 830am, my average time between smokes is off and my first smoke in the morning says my average is several hours. Even by end of day it still says hours between smokes because of that sleeping gap. A sleep button would be amazing compared to adjusting settings every other day. I don't ALWAYS sleep at the same time EVERY day. I don't want to go into settings to adjust anything. I'm going to sleep, waking up, ignore that time. Simple.

author: Stacy Enyeart
comment: This is the best app i have used so far. I bought the pro version. Very easy to track when you smoke and you can input your craving level, mood, and satisfaction level after the smoke. There is only one thing I don't like about it. For "number of smokes per day" if you change that number out changes your entire history instead of just that day and future days. So when I started I was at 20 smokes per day. Now I'm at 10, but that makes it look like all the previous days I failed to meet my goal because I smoked more than 10.

author: Phil Brosgol
comment: Great app, I love that each time you add a record it's color coded to indicate if you are on track or not. Works for any habit you are trying to quit, even though it says "smoke" everywhere... I'd give it five stars if the charts were a little better. Because of how the zoom works, if you zoom in and try to scroll it will swipe to the next screen. Irritating, but not a big deal.

author: Jennifer Halladay
comment: Although I haven't quit smoking yet I love this app of keeping track I set limit for every 4 hours I could smoke first week 2nd and 3rd week every 5 hours hopefully next week every six hours and eventually stop! I have cut back drastically I was smoking a pack a day! This app definitely has helped
